diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with Whipple’s triad: neuroglycopenic symptoms, confirmed low glucose levels at the time of symptoms, and rapid resolution of symptoms after correction of hypoglycemia. His history of recurrent episodes consistent with hypoglycemia, improved with oral intake, and exacerbated by fasting and alcohol use supported the diagnosis of insulinoma. Additional investigations, including fasting studies, confirmed hypoglycemia during episodes, aligning with insulinoma characteristics.
